item.title: Introducing our closing keynote speaker: Jenny Wong
item.dc:creator: admin
item.description: Jenny is a Community Engineer at Human Made. Her love for development goes beyond the screen & she is an advocate for both the PHP and WordPress communities. As a speaker, community event organiser and PHP Women evangelist, you can usually find her loudly cheering people on to share knowledge & contribute back to their communities.
item.content:encoded:
Jenny Wong

Keynote Speaker
@miss_jwo

Jenny is a Community Engineer at Human Made. Her love for development goes beyond the screen & she is an advocate for both the PHP and WordPress communities.

As a speaker, community event organiser and PHP Women evangelist, you can usually find her loudly cheering people on to share knowledge & contribute back to their communities.

item.title: Early Bird tickets available now!
item.dc:creator: admin
item.description: PHPConf.Asia is happening on 22 & 23 September at NUSS Kent Ridge Guild House. Get your tickets today! Find out more about the speakers.
item.content:encoded:
PHPConf.Asia is happening on 22 & 23 September at NUSS Kent Ridge Guild House. Get your tickets today!

Find out more about the speakers.

item.title: PHPConf.Asia adopts a Code of Conduct
item.dc:creator: admin
item.description: We are pleased to publish our official Code of Conduct for all attendees, exhibitors and all our conference staff. Our Code of Conduct is adapted from PyCon Code of Conduct and the GeekFeminism.org Code of Conduct. In it, we detail our definition of harassment, methods of reporting, appropriate response from our staff and participants and also the consequences (if any). […]
item.content:encoded:
We are pleased to publish our official Code of Conduct for all attendees, exhibitors and all our conference staff. Our Code of Conduct is adapted from PyCon Code of Conduct and the GeekFeminism.org Code of Conduct.

In it, we detail our definition of harassment, methods of reporting, appropriate response from our staff and participants and also the consequences (if any).

Do feel free to send us your comment or provide us feedback at admin@phpconf.asia.

item.title: We support Bitcoin!
item.dc:creator: admin
item.description: So we just added support for payment of conference ticket via bitcoin. However, due to the extra administrative work needed to support Bitcoin, we are only accepting payment in a fixed denomination (BTC 0.80). Here’s the deep link to the payment page: https://phpconfasia.codecraft.com.sg/?code=btcpayment
item.content:encoded:
So we just added support for payment of conference ticket via bitcoin.

However, due to the extra administrative work needed to support Bitcoin, we are only accepting payment in a fixed denomination (BTC 0.80).

Here’s the deep link to the payment page: https://phpconfasia.codecraft.com.sg/?code=btcpayment
